data.title: The Selfish Giant, First Edition
data.meta_description: The Selfish Giant by Wilde, Oscar. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Gallagher, Susan Saelig (illustrator). MacDonald 1996 first edition thus. Pages clean and bright, binding firm, minor shelf wear to cover. ALL ITEMS ARE DISPATCHED FROM THE UK WITHIN 48 HOURS ( BOOKS ORDERED OVER THE WEEKEND DISPATCHED ON MONDAY) ALL OVERSEAS ORDERS SENT BY TRACKABLE AIR MAIL. IF YOU ARE LOCATED OUTSIDE THE UK PLEASE ASK US FOR A POSTAGE QUOTE FOR MULTI VOLUME SETS BEFORE ORDERING.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. Gertraud and Walter Reiner (illustrator). First UK. Hardback: illustrated throughout in grey/b/w from the prize-winning film by GERTRAUD & WALTER REINER, dj is worn on the edges, piece missing from the lower back edge, a few marks, price clipped, covers (mainly the back cover) have some crayon marks (all different colours, flyleaves have darkened strips. lower page edges lightly finger creased, internally vg. obl 4to, (62pp). The tale of a giant who shut up his garden so that the children could no longer play in it, until he saw that, in his selfishness, he had shut out happiness and sunshine too.

Softcover. Condition: Fine. First Edition. Housed in a stiff plastic sleeve, though near pristine of interior, just a bit sunned/toned along edges. Green, black illustrations, quite fine, by Pauline French. Unpaginated, but roughly 24 pp. Simple stiff card stock wraps, printed.Member, I.O.B.A., C.B.A., and adherent to the highest ethical standards. Additional postage may be required for oversize or especially heavy volumes, and for sets.

Hard cover. Russell, P Craig (illustrator). First edition. Sewn binding. Cloth over boards. 48 p. Contains: Illustrations. Fairy Tales of Oscar Wilde, 1. Audience: Children/juvenile. Book is crisp, clean and tight, near fine, jacket has a 3/4th inch tear at the bottom front edge at the spine, otherwise very good plus. not price clipped first edition. Very good in very good dust jacket.

Decorative Cloth. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. Charles Robinson (illustrator). 1st Edition. Fine, copy of this collection of tales by Wilde. This copy is bound with leather points and a ribbed leather spine. The points and the top of the spine do show some wear. The interior is clean and unmarked and the lovely illustrations are bright and fresh. There is a small piece missing from the bottom of the last free end paper. The ribbon book mark is still present as issued. There is also a small red dot present on the inside of the rear board. Overall a nice copy with lovely illustrations.

Wrappers. Condition: Very Good. Limited. [10] pp. Sewn into white wrappers with blind-stamped title, heavy endsheets hand-marbled on one side by Christina Russell and Don Guyot, title page decoration by Rick Lindberg. Designed by Alan Ligda. Printed using custom inks on Leaf hand-made natural white wove paper. Edition limited to 135 numbered copies; this is copy no. 119, signed by Alan Ligda. Head and heel of spine and wrapper edges and corners lightly bumped; a touch of dustsoiling to wrappers; discoloration to front and rear blank pages, a result of offsetting from endsheet marbling; faint stain to blank verso of rear endsheet. Size: 4to.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good+. Bell, Bill (illustrator). First Edition; First Printing. Laminated pictorial boards, just a hint of edge rubbing, in like DJ, with one 1" closed tear, repaired with tape. Now protected in a mylar jacket. ; Square 4to 9" - 11" tall; 40 pages.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. Lisbeth Zwerger (illustrator). 1st Edition. A short fantasy story for children by the Irish author Oscar Wilde. It was first published in 1888 in the anthology The Happy Prince and Other Tales. This edition is illustrated by Lisbeth Zwerger of Vienna who received two gold medals at the International Biennial of Illustration in Bratislava, three graphic prizes at the Bologna International Book Fair, two Best Illustrated Books awards from the New York Times and in the year of this publication a nomination for the Hans Christian Andersen Award for Illustration. First edition with a tiny closed tear by the the top of the spine. book.

Hard Cover in Slipcase. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: No Jacket ( as Issued ). Baker-Smith, Grahame (illustrator). First Thus. First printing of the Folio Society edition. With an introduction by Jeanette Winterson. Illustrated by Grahame Baker-Smith. A fine, bright, crisp copy ( no blemishes, no fading, no inscriptions - unread ) in a fine, fresh and unfaded slipcase. Paypal accepted. Please note that this is a heavy book and that postage will be a little more than that quoted by ABE.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: VG -. Kate Seredy (illustrator). First Edition. Hardcover, First edition. White cloth cover with decorative front cover in pink and blue is clean and attractive. Bottom edge has a bump and some shelfwear. Previous owner's name neatly inked on FEP. No other marks in the book Dustjacket is soiled and faded , and missing 1/4 " chips at the spine and flap folds.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. First separate edition thus, by this publisher [issued as a Christmas keepsake by Walter Z. Kolasa, "With Season's Greetings and Best Wishes," December, 1954]. Illustrations by William F.M. Kay. Octavo. [24]pp. Illustrated papercovered boards. Spine is a bit dull, else a fine, bright copy.

Softcover. Dust Jacket Condition: No Dust Jacket. Illustrated by Walter Crane (illustrator). First Edition. Grey paper with red lettering, decal; edges, staple binding, toned around edges; Limited Edition 374/500 taken from The Happy Prince and Other Tales, London 1888; designed by Fred Weber; Very Good- edges, staple binding, toned around edges;
